articles.title: Preparatory committees for welcoming Kim Jong Il's election as President formed abroad
Halt to repression of champions of reunification in S. Korea urged
articles.content:
Preparatory committees for welcoming Kim Jong Il's election as President formed abroad 
   Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Preparatory committees for welcoming Kim Jong Il's          election as President and celebrating the 50th anniversary of the DPRK were inaugurated in Ecuador and Nigeria on August 20 and 22.
   The chairman of the Nigeria-DPRK Friendship Association and the chairman of the Ecuadorian Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea were elected chairmen of the preparatory committees.
   The Danish committee for welcoming the election of Kim Jong Il as head of state of DPRK was formed in Copenhagen on August 23.

articles.title: S. Korean Christians vow to struggle for reunification
articles.content:
Halt to repression of champions of reunification in S. Korea urged
 Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- The South Korean authorities have revealed their intention to detain the delegates of Hanchongryon (South Korean Federation of University Student Councils and Father Mun Gyu Hyon and his party, who participated in the August 15 grand pro-reunification festival at Panmunjom.
   In this connection, a spokesman of the commonwealth of independent states regional headquarters of Pomminryon (National Alliance for the Country's Reunification) made public a statement on August 18.
   The statement noted that the "Grand Festival for National Reconciliation, Unity and Reunification", which was held amid the ever growing desire of the entire fellow countrymen for national reunification, was a festival which would be recorded as a brilliant chapter in the Korean nation's history of the reunification movement.
   However, the South Korean authorities employed all means to obstruct the festival from the initial stage, it said.
   The statement strongly urged them to immediately stop the repression of patriotic-minded students and religionists, as unanimously demanded by the entire fellow countrymen.

articles.title: U.S. aerial espionage on DPRK
articles.content:
S. Korean Christians vow to struggle for reunification

   Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- The council for Christian Churches, the Pastors' Council for Justice and Peace and other Christian groups of South Korea published a "declaration of 1,000 Christians for implementation of the north-south agreement and  for peace and disarmament",  said the South Korean paper Hangyore on August 15.
   In the declaration the organizations said they consider the "agreement on reconciliation, nonaggression, cooperation and exchange between the north and the south", signed by the north and the south,  to be the most important starting point for bringing  earlier reunification.
   They declared they would stand in the van of struggle for the implementation of the agreement, detente, peace  and disarmament.

articles.title: National basketball tournament
articles.content:
U.S. aerial espionage on DPRK
Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- The U.S. committed air espionage on north Korea on 130 odd occasions this month, military sources said.
   Mobilized for the espionage were U-2, RC-135, E-3, RC-12, RF-4c, EH-60 and other strategic and tactical reconnaissance planes based in South Korea and overseas.
   Especially, U-2 high-altitude strategic reconnaissance plane flew  for espionage on 30 odd occasions during the month.

articles.title: S. Korean authorities hit for brutal suppression
articles.content:
National basketball tournament
  Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- The National basketball tournament, which started on August 20 to mark the 50th National Day, closed on August 28.
   The tournament, divided into adult and junior groups, was held in a round-robin by men and women teams selected from provinces.
   Pyongyang cagers came first in the adult and junior (men and women) events.

articles.title: S. Korean authorities hit for persecution of Father Mun Kyu Hyon
articles.content:
S. Korean authorities hit for brutal suppression
    Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- The preparatory committee for the "Grand Festival for National Reconciliation, Unity and Reunification" released a statement on August 29 denouncing the South Korean authorities for their recent brutal suppression of the patriotic champions of reunification and students who had participated in the August 15 grand pro-reunification festival.
   The statement says the recent festival attended by delegates from 68 political parties and organizations--two from the south, 38 from abroad and 28 from the north is a brilliant victory of the policy of great national unity, policy of reunification, over the policy of confrontation and division.
   Having failed to destroy the festival, the South Korean authorities arrested Father Mun Kyu Hyon on a charge of violating the "National Security Law" in the wake of his visit to Pyongyang and participation in the festival. They are hell-bent on unprecedented-in-scope suppression of pro-reunification, patriotic forces, including the students under the influence of the South Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon), the statement says, and continues:
   History and the nation will certainly make the South Korean authorities pay dearly for their crimes such as the brutal suppression of patriotic champions of reunification and deal a heavy blow at the enemies of reunification, the traitors to the nation.
   The more the South Korean authorities are engaged in suppression of pro-reunification, patriotic forces, the more crimes they will commit against the nation. They should be aware of this. They should abolish the anti-reunification "National Security Law" and dismantle the fascist plot-breeding "Agency for National Security Planning." they also should unconditionally and immediately release the unreasonably arrested officials of the south headquarters of the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification and "Hanchongryon"-lining students.

articles.title: Outstanding leader working hard to exalt President Kim Il Sung's exploits
articles.content:
S. Korean authorities hit for persecution of Father Mun Kyu Hyon

    Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun today bitterly denounces the South Korean authorities for arresting Father Mun Kyu Hyon of the South Korean Catholic Priests' Council for Justice on a charge of violating the "National Security Law" on August 27 for the mere reason that he took part in the August 15 grand pro-reunification festival during his visit to North Korea.
   The news analyst says:
   The arrest is an open challenge to all the Koreans who want national reconciliation, unity and reunification= it is retaliation against the pro-reunification, pro-democracy patriotic forces of South Korea.
   It proves that "reconciliation," "cooperation" and "dialogue" on the lips of the South Korean authorities do not deserve even a passing note.
   The South Korean authorities should stop suppressing the patriotic champions of reunification and immediately release Father Mun and  all other pro-reunification patriotic figures and students.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on "new labor policy"
articles.content:
Outstanding leader working hard to exalt President Kim Il Sung's exploits
   Pyongyang, August 30 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun today runs an article on the wise leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, who is working hard to exalt generation after generation the exploits of the President Kim Il Sung in state building.
   The article says:
   The history of Kim Jong Il's revolutionary activities spanning more than 30 years is characterised by the fact that he has held the president in high esteem as the father of socialist Korea and worked hard to exalt the exploits of the President in state building, and the fact that Kim Jong Il, basing himself on the President's exploits, has built the country into a socialist bulwark of Juche.
   The greatness of Kim Jong Il's leadership is fully demonstrated in the ongoing struggle to build Korea into a strong and prosperious state of Juche, the article says, and elaborates on his wise guidance.
   The article goes on:
   Kim Jong Il resolutely defends the President's idea and theories of state building and develops and enriches them forever.
   To remould man, nature and society just as the President intended and did and thus turn the country into Kim Il Sung's Korea which is the full embodiment of the President's idea of state building is the fixed will of Kim Jong Il.
   His idea and theories are, in essence, to build Korea into a strong and prosperous state of Juche where the Juche idea is fully applied and efflorescing.
   Kim Jong Il also builds the country into a thriving invincible fortress of socialism in reliance upon the foundations laid by the President.
   Under the wise guidance of Kim Jong Il great achievements have been gained in all aspects of Korea's socialist construction, including politics, the economy, culture and military affairs and the nation's defence capabilities increased remarkably.
